summary: This document is an email forwarding a defense letter regarding proposed limiting instructions in the U.S. v. Maxwell case. The letter from the defense attorneys is submitted temporarily under seal to Judge Nathan's chambers.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case U.S. v. Maxwell, referenced in the case caption and subject line.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge to whom the defense's letter regarding proposed limiting instructions is addressed.

connections.description: Maxwell is the defendant in the criminal case over which Judge Nathan is presiding.

events.title: Court Issues Opinion and Order on Limiting Instructions
events.description: The Court issued an Opinion and Order regarding proposed limiting instructions in the case.

events.title: Defense Submits Sealed Letter on Jury Instructions
events.description: The defense attorneys for Maxwell submitted a letter to Judge Nathan regarding the proposed limiting instructions, filing it temporarily under seal.

keyFacts: The document is an email forwarding a defense letter in the case U.S. v. Maxwell (S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN)).
The defense letter, submitted by Cohen & Gresser LLP, addresses proposed limiting instructions from a Court Opinion and Order dated November 19, 2021.
The defense submitted its response letter temporarily under seal.
The law firm Cohen & Gresser LLP represents the defendant Maxwell in this matter.
The correspondence is marked as confidential and subject to attorney-client privilege.
